intro: Lindsaea cultrata var. parvula, commonly known as the small-leaf lindsaea, is a species of epiphytic fern native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Bromeliaceae and is characterized by its compact, rosette-like growth habit. The plant produces small, delicate leaves that are often covered in fine, hairy structures, aiding in moisture retention. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found growing on trees or rocks. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
